questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a firewall in network security?
choices: To monitor and control network traffic
questions.answer: To monitor and control network traffic

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common type of malware?
questions.answer: Firewall

questions.question: What does SSL/TLS stand for?
questions.answer: Secure Socket Layer/Transport Layer Security

questions.question: Which type of attack aims to make a system or network unavailable by overwhelming it with traffic?
questions.answer: Denial of Service (DoS)

questions.question: What is the main difference between symmetric and asymmetric encryption?
choices: Asymmetric encryption uses only one key
Symmetric encryption uses a public and private key pair
Asymmetric encryption uses different keys for encryption and decryption
questions.answer: Asymmetric encryption uses different keys for encryption and decryption

questions.question: Which of the following is a best practice for password security?
choices: Using the same password for multiple accounts
Using complex, unique passwords for each account
Changing passwords only when required by the system
questions.answer: Using complex, unique passwords for each account

questions.question: What is phishing primarily designed to do?
choices: Trick users into revealing sensitive information
questions.answer: Trick users into revealing sensitive information

questions.question: Which protocol is used to secure web browsing?
questions.answer: HTTPS

questions.question: What is the purpose of an Intrusion Detection System (IDS)?
choices: To monitor network traffic for suspicious activity
questions.answer: To monitor network traffic for suspicious activity

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically a function of antivirus software?
choices: Scanning files for known malware signatures
questions.answer: Encrypting network traffic

questions.question: What is the main purpose of network segmentation in security?
choices: To reduce the attack surface and contain breaches
questions.answer: To reduce the attack surface and contain breaches

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a worm?
choices: It requires user interaction to spread
It attaches itself to legitimate files
It can self-replicate and spread without user interaction
It always encrypts data for ransom
questions.answer: It can self-replicate and spread without user interaction

questions.question: What is the primary goal of encryption in network security?
questions.answer: To protect data confidentiality

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common method used in social engineering attacks?
questions.answer: Packet sniffing

questions.question: What is the purpose of a VPN in network security?
choices: To provide a secure, encrypted connection over a public network
questions.answer: To provide a secure, encrypted connection over a public network

questions.question: Which of the following is a key principle of the 'defense in depth' strategy?
choices: Using a single, powerful security solution
Implementing multiple layers of security controls
questions.answer: Implementing multiple layers of security controls

questions.question: What is the main difference between an Intrusion Detection System (IDS) and an Intrusion Prevention System (IPS)?
choices: IDS is software-based, while IPS is hardware-based
IDS only detects threats, while IPS can also block them
IPS is outdated technology, while IDS is more modern
IDS works at the application layer, while IPS works at the network layer
questions.answer: IDS only detects threats, while IPS can also block them

questions.question: What is the purpose of multi-factor authentication?
choices: To eliminate the need for passwords
To add additional layers of security beyond just a password
questions.answer: To add additional layers of security beyond just a password

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical component of a security policy?
questions.answer: Network speed optimization

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of patch management in network security?
choices: To add new features to software
To fix known vulnerabilities and security issues
To customize software for specific users
questions.answer: To fix known vulnerabilities and security issues

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a 'zero-day vulnerability'?
choices: A vulnerability that has existed for zero days
A vulnerability known to the vendor but not yet patched
A vulnerability that causes zero damage
A vulnerability that affects zero users
questions.answer: A vulnerability known to the vendor but not yet patched

questions.question: What is the main purpose of network segmentation?
choices: To reduce the cost of network infrastructure
To limit the spread of security breaches within a network
questions.answer: To limit the spread of security breaches within a network

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a Trojan horse in cybersecurity?
choices: It always encrypts files for ransom
It disguises itself as legitimate software
It spreads automatically to other computers
It is easily detectable by basic antivirus software
questions.answer: It disguises itself as legitimate software

questions.question: What is the primary function of a Web Application Firewall (WAF)?
choices: To filter and monitor HTTP traffic
questions.answer: To filter and monitor HTTP traffic

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically considered a benefit of using HTTPS?
questions.answer: Faster page loading

questions.question: What is the main purpose of a security audit?
choices: To identify and assess vulnerabilities in an organization's security posture
To train employees on new software
questions.answer: To identify and assess vulnerabilities in an organization's security posture

questions.question: Which of the following is a key principle of the 'least privilege' concept in security?
choices: Giving users only the access rights they need to perform their job
Implementing the strictest security measures for all users
questions.answer: Giving users only the access rights they need to perform their job

questions.question: What is the primary goal of a security awareness training program?
choices: To teach employees advanced hacking techniques
To educate users about security risks and best practices
To reduce the organization's IT budget
questions.answer: To educate users about security risks and best practices

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically a function of a Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) system?
choices: Correlation of security events from multiple sources
questions.answer: Automatic patching of vulnerabilities

questions.question: What is the main purpose of data loss prevention (DLP) tools?
choices: To prevent unauthorized access or transfer of sensitive data
To compress data for efficient storage
questions.answer: To prevent unauthorized access or transfer of sensitive data
